analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: bcu gcig po 'di dag ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: Faith of Great Skillful Means asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid do //

original: rnyog pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnyog pa rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu / 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i phyir @14a *//

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Great Skillful Means said:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid ma rtogs pa'i shes pa nyid theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba dag la the tshom med pa dang / the tshom gyi rnyog pa dang bral ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid ma rtogs pa'i shes pa nyid theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba dag la the tshom med pa dang / the tshom gyi rnyog pa dang bral ba ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not that bodhisattvas who have not realized the nature of phenomena are free of doubt and the turbidity of doubt with regard to the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi dring las mos pa'i stobs kyis kyang theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba dag la the tshom med cing the tshom gyi rnyog pa dang bral ba @14b yin no; ;'di ltar las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mos
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi dring las mos pa'i stobs kyis kyang theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba dag la the tshom med cing the tshom gyi rnyog pa dang bral ba @14b yin no; ;'di ltar las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mos
translated: Bodhisattvas, on the other hand, have faith in the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle through the power of their interest, and they are free of doubts and the turbidity of doubts.

original: pas spyod pa la zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: pas spyod pa la zhugs pa ni /
translated: In this way, beginner bodhisattvas who have entered the level of engagement through aspiration

original: theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba bstan pa dag la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dpang du byas nas chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba bstan pa dag la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dpang du byas nas chos 'di dag ni /
translated: have faith in the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle by taking the Thus-Gone One himself as their witness and thinking,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: “These teachings were taught by the Thus-Gone One.”

original: zhes de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa la mos pa bzhag nas chos rnams la ma log par mos pa 'jog go /
analyzed: zhes de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa la mos pa bzhag nas chos rnams la ma log par mos pa 'jog go /
translated: In this way, they establish a correct faith in the teachings by placing their faith in the Thus-Gone One’s realization.

original: gzhan gyi dring las mos pa'i stobs des de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing the tshom dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring las mos pa'i stobs des de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde'i chos rnams la the tshom med cing the tshom dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Through the power of their interest that is dependent on others, they are free of doubts and the turbidity of doubts with regard to the profound and extensive sūtras taught by the Thus-Gone One.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽de lta bu ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / de lta bu ni /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa'i gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du blta'o //
translated: this is the characteristic of the clarity of the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is conducive to the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Great Skillful Trust said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pas brlan pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bgyi ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pas brlan pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bgyi ba gang lags /
translated: what is the characteristic of the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is conducive to the Great Vehicle that is to be known as being moistened?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa dang ldan pa'i yid bde bas lus brlan pa dang / sems brlan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa dang ldan pa'i yid bde bas lus brlan pa dang / sems brlan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is conducive to the Great Vehicle is characterized by the moistening of the body and mind with the bliss of the mind that possesses trust.

original: de'i brlan pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i brlan pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is to be known as its characteristic of moistening.

original: de'ang byang @15a *//
analyzed: de'ang byang @15a *//
translated: Moreover,

original: chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde bas lus dang sems sim par byed pa yin gyi /🔽'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde bas ni /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde bas lus dang sems sim par byed pa yin gyi / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde bas ni /
translated: The bliss and mental pleasure of bodhisattvas who have faith in the Great Vehicle and who are in the Great Vehicle refreshes their bodies and minds.

original: ma yin no //🔽gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi bde ba dang / yid bde ba gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: ma yin no // gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi bde ba dang / yid bde ba gang yin pa des ni /
translated: This is not the case with the bliss and mental pleasure that comes from the objects of desire of those who enjoy the objects of desire.

original: 'di 'dra bar de dag gi lus dang sems sim par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra bar de dag gi lus dang sems sim par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The bliss and mental pleasure of sentient beings in the form and formless realms does not refresh their bodies and minds in the same way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de dag gi bde ba dang / yid bde ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi bde ba dang / yid bde ba ni /
translated: Because their bliss and mental pleasure

original: ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: ma zhi ba'o //
translated: is not peaceful.

original: ci'i phyir ma zhi ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma zhi ba zhe na /
translated: Why is it not peaceful?

original: gang 'dod pa'i yon tan las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba de dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi bde ba dang / yid bde ba de ni /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i yon tan las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba de dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi bde ba dang / yid bde ba de ni /
translated: The bliss and mental pleasure that comes from the objects of desire and the bliss and mental pleasure of those who enjoy the objects of desire

original: de tsam du 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang ldan pa ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de tsam du 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang ldan pa ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of non-pacification is the presence of desire and anger.

original: mtho dman gyi rgyu'i phyir ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtho dman gyi rgyu'i phyir ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of non-pacification is the cause of high and low.

original: bden pa rnams la yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba'i rjes su song ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba'i rjes su song ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of non-pacification is the doubt and uncertainty that arises in relation to the truths.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / de'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa tshad med pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang / de'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa tshad med pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of non-pacification is the limitless views that arise from the root of grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine.”

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir ci @15b log dang / g-yeng ba dang / rgod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / bag med pa dang / ngo tsha med pa'i rtsa ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir ci @15b log dang / g-yeng ba dang / rgod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / bag med pa dang / ngo tsha med pa'i rtsa ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-pacification is the root of the secondary afflictions, such as agitation, distraction, excitation, dullness, carelessness, and shamelessness.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i rtsa ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i rtsa ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-pacification is the root of the various actions that are created in the five realms.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus shing 'gro ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus shing 'gro ba'i phyir rab tu ma zhi ba'o //
translated: It is not peaceful because it is included in the truth of suffering and because it is the cause of transmigration.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bur bcas pa'i rgyun la 'jug pa dang ldan pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba ni /🔽rab tu ma zhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bur bcas pa'i rgyun la 'jug pa dang ldan pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba ni / rab tu ma zhi ba ste /
translated: in this way, the pleasure and mental satisfaction that arise from the five sense pleasures are not peaceful, because they are associated with the engagement in the continuity of the afflictions of karma and life, along with their causes and results.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de'i lus dang sems sim par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i lus dang sems sim par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: they do not refresh the body and mind.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba la'ang rnam pa de dag gis ci rigs par rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba la'ang rnam pa de dag gis ci rigs par rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the pleasure and mental satisfaction that arise from the sense pleasures of those who enjoy sense pleasures are not peaceful, so too, the pleasure and mental satisfaction that arise from meditative concentration in the form and formless realms should be understood to have the characteristics of not being peaceful in the appropriate ways.

original: rab tu ma zhi bas na /
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi bas na /
translated: Because they are not peaceful,

original: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la lus dang sems sim par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la lus dang sems sim par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the noble Dharma and Vinaya, the body and mind do not become calm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The bliss and mental pleasure that arise from faith in the Great Vehicle for the bodhisattvas

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i rab tu ma @16a *//🔽zhi ba dang bral ba dang / mtho dman gyi rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / bden pa la yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i rab tu ma @16a *// zhi ba dang bral ba dang / mtho dman gyi rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / bden pa la yid gnyis dang the tshom za ba'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang /
translated: are free from the lack of peace of attachment and aversion,🔽free from the lack of peace of high and low status, free from the lack of peace of doubt and uncertainty about the truths, and free from the lack of peace of the immeasurable views that arise from the root of grasping at “I” and grasping at “mine.”

original: de'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa tshad med pa'i rab tu ma zhi pa dang bral ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa phyin ci log dang / g-yeng ba dang / rgod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / bag med pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa tshad med pa'i rab tu ma zhi pa dang bral ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa phyin ci log dang / g-yeng ba dang / rgod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / bag med pa dang /
translated: They are free from the lack of peace of the secondary afflictions, the distortions, distraction, excitation, dullness, and carelessness.

original: ngo tsha med pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / 'gro ba lnga'i las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / 'gro ba lnga'i las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba dang /
translated: It is free from the lack of peace that is shamelessness. It is free from the lack of peace that is the creation of the various actions of the five classes of beings. It is free from the lack of peace that is included in the truth of suffering.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bur bcas pa'i rgyun las 'jug pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bur bcas pa'i rgyun las 'jug pa'i rab tu ma zhi ba dang bral ba'i phyir rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: In this way, it is free from the lack of peace that is the engagement of the continuum of the cause and result of the afflictions, karma, and the afflictions of life. Therefore, it is peace.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos 'dul pa la lus dang sems sim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos 'dul pa la lus dang sems sim par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of peace, the body and mind are refreshed in the training of the noble ones.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pas brlan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pas brlan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Son of noble family,🔽this is the characteristic of the bodhisattvas’ moisture of faith in the Great Vehicle, which is for the sake of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Mahāmati said:

original: bcom @16b 'das; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pas brlan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba'i don 'di ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: bcom @16b 'das; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pas brlan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba'i don 'di ngo mtshar to //
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattvas’ faith in the Great Vehicle, which is moistened by the characteristics of the Great Vehicle, is wonderful indeed!

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i don las rab tu mos par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i don las rab tu mos par bgyi'o //
translated: we will be inspired by the meaning of the happiness and mental satisfaction that arise from the bodhisattvas’ faith in the Great Vehicle.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid gang lags /
translated: what are the characteristics of the aspects of the bodhisattvas’ faith in the Great Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa gsum gyis theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa gsum gyis theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'jug ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas engage in faith in the Great Vehicle for three reasons:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / mngon par dga' ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the aspect of confidence, the aspect of change, and the aspect of delight.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yid ches pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yid ches pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa ji lta bu lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One, how do bodhisattvas engage with the Mahāyāna out of confidence in the Great Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zab cing rgya che ba'i chos bstan pa rnams la thog ma nyid du yod par mos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zab cing rgya che ba'i chos bstan pa rnams la thog ma nyid du yod par mos so //
translated: bodhisattvas first have confidence in the profound and vast teachings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di @17a *// ltar chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di @17a *// ltar chos 'di dag ni /
translated: Because these teachings

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi yul de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsungs par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi yul de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsungs par 'os pa'o //
translated: are the domain of the thus-gone ones alone, and only the thus-gone ones can speak of them.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: only the thus-gone ones have fully awakened to them,

original: rtog ge pa rnams kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog ge pa rnams kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: and they are not the domain of logicians.

original: 'di ltar rtog ge pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog ge pa rnams ni /
translated: Because logicians

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos 'di lta bu dag thos na dngang bar gyur te rtogs par lta ba ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i chos 'di lta bu dag thos na dngang bar gyur te rtogs par lta ba ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could they have the view that understands that when they hear such profound and vast teachings, they will be frightened?

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: they are

original: rtog ge pa rnams kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog ge pa rnams kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: not the domain of logicians.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ji ltar de dag gis bstan pa'i chos de dag kyang de bzhin du yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ji ltar de dag gis bstan pa'i chos de dag kyang de bzhin du yod de /
translated: Just as the enlightenment of the buddhas is, so too are the teachings of those buddhas.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos bstan pa zab cing rgya che ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa la yod pa nyid du mos nas byang chub sems dpa' yid ches pa'i rnam pas dad pa skyed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos bstan pa zab cing rgya che ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa la yod pa nyid du mos nas byang chub sems dpa' yid ches pa'i rnam pas dad pa skyed do //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva generates faith with a confident attitude, having conviction in the profound and vast teachings of those buddha bhagavans that are endowed with results.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Bhagavan,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i slad du theg pa chen po la dad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i slad du theg pa chen po la dad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa ji lta bu lags /
translated: how do bodhisattvas engage with the Mahāyāna in terms of the faith that is the cause of the Mahāyāna?”

translated: this is how you should know that the Great Vehicle's faith in the Great Vehicle for the sake of the Bodhisattva Vehicle arises from a friend.🔽He said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yid la bgyid pa las skye ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yid la bgyid pa las skye ba gang lags /
translated: what is the Great Vehicle's faith in the Great Vehicle for the sake of the Bodhisattva Vehicle that arises from attention?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgra ji bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgra ji bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: the bodhisattva who discriminates the teachings in a way that is not in accordance with reality, in accordance with the literal meaning,

original: theg pa chen po la dad pa skye ba'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la dad pa skye ba'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: is not a basis for the generation of faith in the Great Vehicle.

original: sgra ji bzhin du ma yin gyi dgongs pa las byung ba'i don tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du ma yin gyi dgongs pa las byung ba'i don tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni /
translated: But attention to the meaning that arises from the intention, not in accordance with the literal meaning,

original: theg pa chen po la dad pa skye ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la dad pa skye ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: It is the basis for the arising of faith in the Great Vehicle.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sgra ji bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sgra ji bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad 'byung ngo //
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva’s incorrect discernment of phenomena according to the literal meaning gives rise to twenty-eight false views.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mtshan mar lta ba dang / lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba dang / tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / mtshan mar lta ba dang / lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba dang / tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang /
translated: They are as follows:🔽the view of signs, the view of the view as not a view, the view that denies conventional reality, the view that denies the afflictions, the view that denies suchness,

original: sbyor ba sel ba'i lta ba dang / yongs @29b su 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lta ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba sel ba'i lta ba dang / yongs @29b su 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lta ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba dang /
translated: the view that denies application, the view of appropriation, the view of transformation, the view of non-liberation, the view of non-transgression, the view of emergence,

original: sgrib pa la sogs pa'i lta ba dang / brnyas pa'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba dang / bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa la sogs pa'i lta ba dang / brnyas pa'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba dang / bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba dang /
translated: the view of obscuration, the view of contempt, the view of complete agitation, the view of the increase of demerit, the view of wrong views, the view of fruitless exertion,

original: 'phel bar lta ba dang / slu ba'a lta ba dang / khas mi len par lta ba dang / g-yo'i lta ba dang / chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba dang / bkur sti byed par lta ba dang / skur pa'i lta ba dang / rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba dang /
analyzed: 'phel bar lta ba dang / slu ba'a lta ba dang / khas mi len par lta ba dang / g-yo'i lta ba dang / chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba dang / bkur sti byed par lta ba dang / skur pa'i lta ba dang / rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba dang /
translated: the view of increase, the view of deception, the view of non-acceptance, the view of deceit, the view of punishment, the view of honor, the view of slander, the view of firm delusion,

original: mi smra ba'i lta ba dang / lta ba chen po dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi smra ba'i lta ba dang / lta ba chen po dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba'o //
translated: the view of silence, the view of great views, and the view of manifest pride.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mtshan mar lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan mar lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: what is the view of characteristics?

original: gang ngas 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid las dgongs te chos rnams med do //
analyzed: gang ngas 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid las dgongs te chos rnams med do //
translated: It is the view that I have taught that phenomena do not exist, intending the nature that arises from the coming together of causes and conditions.

original: zhes bstan pa de la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / rnam par byang ba las byung ba'i chos rnams la'ang mngon par zhen cing med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung bas med par lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / rnam par byang ba las byung ba'i chos rnams la'ang mngon par zhen cing med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung bas med par lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since they apprehend the sign of nonexistence, they fall into the view of nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir mtshan mar lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan mar lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of signs.

original: de la lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba ni /
translated: The view that the view is not a view is as follows.

original: med par lta ba de la byang chub sems dpa' de sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pas lta ba ma yin par 'du shes par 'gyur @30a *//
analyzed: med par lta ba de la byang chub sems dpa' de sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pas lta ba ma yin par 'du shes par 'gyur @30a *//
translated: Since bodhisattvas conceive of the view of nonexistence in a literal way, they think that it is not a view.

original: ro; ;gang med par lta ba de ni /
analyzed: ro; ;gang med par lta ba de ni /
translated: The view of nonexistence is

original: de'i lta ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de'i lta ba chen po ste /
translated: their great view.

original: de'i phyir lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view that the view is not a view.

original: de la tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view that denies conventional existence, the view that denies the thoroughly afflicted, and the view that denies reality.

original: mtshan mar lta ba des thams cad la skur pa btab pas tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'ang mngon par zhe na /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la'ang mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: mtshan mar lta ba des thams cad la skur pa btab pas tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'ang mngon par zhe na / kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la'ang mngon par zhen te /
translated: Since that view of signs denies everything, it is also the view that denies conventional existence.🔽It is also the view that denies the thoroughly afflicted.

original: de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la'ang mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la'ang mngon par zhen te /
translated: It is also the view that denies reality.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: Therefore, it is called the view that denies conventional existence.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is called the view that denies the thoroughly afflicted.

original: de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is called the view that denies reality.

original: de la sbyor ba sel pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba sel pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view that eliminates application.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba can de nyid gong du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la sbyor ba sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba can de nyid gong du rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la sbyor ba sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: The view of denial is the view that denies the existence of the object of refutation.

original: des na khyad par du 'gro ba las yongs su nyams so //🔽de la yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: des na khyad par du 'gro ba las yongs su nyams so // de la yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: Thus, one falls away from the special progress.🔽The view of grasping is the view that grasps the side of nonexistence when one is certain about the characteristics of phenomena.

original: lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / sbyor ba sel ba'i lta ba can de nyid gzhan dag dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gdon mi za bar byed pa na med pa'i phyogs nyid yongs su 'dzin te /🔽de'i phyir @30b yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / sbyor ba sel ba'i lta ba can de nyid gzhan dag dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gdon mi za bar byed pa na med pa'i phyogs nyid yongs su 'dzin te / de'i phyir @30b yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The view of grasping is the view that grasps the side of nonexistence when one is certain about the characteristics of phenomena.🔽The view of transformation is the view that transforms the meaning of the Mahayana sutras.

original: de la sgyur ba'i lta ba ni /🔽gal te theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i don brjod cing chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de la sgyur ba'i lta ba ni / gal te theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i don brjod cing chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: The view of transformation is the view that transforms the meaning of the Mahayana sutras.

original: med pa'i don du mngon par smra'o; ;zhes don de dag med par lta ba de nyid la sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: med pa'i don du mngon par smra'o; ;zhes don de dag med par lta ba de nyid la sgyur ba ste /
translated: If one says that the meaning of the Mahayana sutras is expressed and that all these phenomena are spoken of as having the meaning of nonexistence, then that view of the nonexistence of those meanings is the view of transformation.

original: de'i phyir sgyur ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyur ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of transformation.

original: de la nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: “Among them, the view of non-liberation is as follows:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: bdag dang / gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba gang yin pa dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba gang yin pa la brten pas de theg pa dman pas kyang rdzags pa'i byang chub tu nges par mi 'byung na /
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba gang yin pa dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba gang yin pa la brten pas de theg pa dman pas kyang rdzags pa'i byang chub tu nges par mi 'byung na /
translated: If one relies on the view of grasping at self and other and the view of transformation, one will not be liberated into complete enlightenment even by the Lesser Vehicle.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lta ci smos /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lta ci smos /
translated: How much less so will one attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment!

original: de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of non-liberation.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba ni /
translated: “Among them, the view of non-offense is as follows:🔽Having viewed the sign of its non-existence, one comes to view it thus:

original: de med pa'i mtshan ma la lta bar gyur nas 'di ltar gang lta ba 'di dang ldan na /
analyzed: de med pa'i mtshan ma la lta bar gyur nas 'di ltar gang lta ba 'di dang ldan na /
translated: ‘If one possesses this view,

original: de gang cung zad 'khrul pa'i nyes byas la spyod kyang byang chub sems dpa' de thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro snyam du lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gang cung zad 'khrul pa'i nyes byas la spyod kyang byang chub sems dpa' de thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro snyam du lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: whatever slight offenses one commits, for that bodhisattva it will all be non-offense.’

original: de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of non-offense.

original: de la 'byung bar lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar lta ba ni /
translated: The view of origination is as follows:

original: gang med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva who views the sign of non-existence thinks as follows:

original: med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba 'di ni /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba 'di ni /
translated: “This view of the sign of non-existence

original: nyes byas kyi kha na ma tho ba thams cad kyi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi kha na ma tho ba thams cad kyi 'byung ba'o //
translated: is the origin of all offenses that are misdeeds.🔽”

original: snyam du sems la /
analyzed: snyam du sems la /
translated: He thinks thus,

original: de ni / 'byung ba ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir 'byung bar lta @31a *//
analyzed: de ni / 'byung ba ma yin te / de'i phyir 'byung bar lta @31a *//
translated: but it is not an origin.

original: ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of origination.

original: de la sgrib pa la gsog pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa la gsog pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view of the accumulation of obscurations is as follows:

original: kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba nyid de /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / 'byung bar lta ba nyid de /
translated: The view of non-offense and the view of origination are the view of the accumulation of obscurations,

original: sgrib pa'i rgyu la de'i gnyen po yin pa'i blo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i rgyu la de'i gnyen po yin pa'i blo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that is the antidote to the cause of obscurations arises.

original: de la brnyas pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la brnyas pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view of contempt is as follows:

original: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyan thos kyi theg pa la brnyas pa'i sems skyed de /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyan thos kyi theg pa la brnyas pa'i sems skyed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who views the sign of non-existence generates a mind of contempt for the vehicle of the hearers,

original: chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni /
translated: thinking, “These dharmas

original: chung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas chos de dag goms par mi bya /
analyzed: chung ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas chos de dag goms par mi bya /
translated: Because they are inferior, bodhisattvas should not cultivate those dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpas chos de dag la mkhas par mi bya'i; byang chub sems dpas chos de dag ring du yongs su spang bar bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos de dag la mkhas par mi bya'i; byang chub sems dpas chos de dag ring du yongs su spang bar bya'o snyam ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas should not become skilled in those dharmas; bodhisattvas should completely abandon those dharmas.

original: de'i phyir brnyas pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brnyas pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of contempt.

original: de la rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: “What is the view of complete agitation?

original: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gang zag de dag la khong khro ba'i sems skyed de /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gang zag de dag la khong khro ba'i sems skyed de /
translated: Bodhisattvas who view the signless give rise to an angry mind toward those individuals who are in the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: 'di dag dang lhan cig gnas par mi bya; smra ba dang / kun tu smra ba dang / kun brjod pa dang / chos gos la sogs pa yongs su spyad pa kun spyad par mi bya'o //🔽snyam ste / de'i phyir rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag dang lhan cig gnas par mi bya; smra ba dang / kun tu smra ba dang / kun brjod pa dang / chos gos la sogs pa yongs su spyad pa kun spyad par mi bya'o // snyam ste / de'i phyir rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They think, ‘I should not live with them, speak with them, converse with them, or use the same Dharma robes and so on as they do.🔽’ Therefore, it is called the view of complete agitation.

original: de la bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba ni /
translated: “What is the view of the increase of demerit?

original: brnyas pa'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' de nyid @31b bsod nams ma yin pa mang du skyed de /
analyzed: brnyas pa'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrugs pa'i lta ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' de nyid @31b bsod nams ma yin pa mang du skyed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who has the view of contempt and the view of complete agitation generates much demerit.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of the increase of demerit.

original: de la log par lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la log par lta ba ni /
translated: Among those, the view of perversion is

original: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid du mi rtog /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid du mi rtog /
translated: the bodhisattva who views the sign of non-existence does not realize emptiness as emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma med par mi rtog /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma med par mi rtog /
translated: He does not realize the signless as signless.

original: smon pa med pa la smon pa med par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa la smon pa med par mi rtog ste /
translated: He does not realize the wishless as wishless.

original: des na / de sgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum po 'di mi sgrub ste /
analyzed: des na / de sgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum po 'di mi sgrub ste /
translated: Therefore, he does not accomplish these three types of meditative concentrations.

original: de'i phyir log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of perversion.

original: de la ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: Among those, the view of fruitless exertion is

original: gang log par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i ngal ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang log par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i ngal ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: the bodhisattva who has the view of perversion will have fruitless exertion in cultivating meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of fruitless toil.

original: de la 'phel bar lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'phel bar lta ba ni /
translated: The view of increase is as follows.

original: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang skye bo'i tshogs chen po lta ba 'di la 'dzud cing skye bo'i tshogs chen po dad par byed pa de bsod nams mang du skyed do //
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang skye bo'i tshogs chen po lta ba 'di la 'dzud cing skye bo'i tshogs chen po dad par byed pa de bsod nams mang du skyed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who views the sign of nonexistence thinks, “The bodhisattva who introduces a great multitude to this view and causes the great multitude to have faith generates much merit.”

original: snyam du lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snyam du lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus he views it.

original: de'i phyir 'phrel bar lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phrel bar lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of increase.

original: de la slu ba'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la slu ba'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view of deception is as follows.

original: gang 'phel bar lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de bdag dang gzhan la bsod nams kyi bsam pas bsod nams bslus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'phel bar lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de bdag dang gzhan la bsod nams kyi bsam pas bsod nams bslus par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who views increase deceives himself and others with the thought of merit.

original: de'i phyir slu ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir slu ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of deception.

original: de la khas mi len par lta ba ni /🔽gang med pa'i mtshan ma la @32a *//
analyzed: de la khas mi len par lta ba ni / gang med pa'i mtshan ma la @32a *//
translated: The view of nonacceptance is as follows.

original: lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva who views the sign of nonexistence thinks, “The bodhisattva who introduces a great multitude to this view and causes the great multitude to have faith generates much demerit.”

original: chos thams cad med pa nyid 'di la gzhan dang rtsod par gyur na /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa nyid 'di la gzhan dang rtsod par gyur na /
translated: If there is a dispute with others about this non-existence of all phenomena,

original: bdag gi phyogs gang yang khas mi blang ste /
analyzed: bdag gi phyogs gang yang khas mi blang ste /
translated: I will not accept any position of my own.

original: bdag gis mi gzugs pa 'ba' zhig tu bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis mi gzugs pa 'ba' zhig tu bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will only remain neutral.

original: de'i phyir khas mi len par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khas mi len par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of non-acceptance.

original: de la g-yo'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la g-yo'i lta ba ni /
translated: As for the view of deception,

original: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid phyogs khas mi len te /🔽sgra ji bzhin du med pa de rnam par 'jog pa na bag bzungs dang ltag chod kyi sbyor bar byed de; bgab zungs dang ltag chod kyi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid phyogs khas mi len te / sgra ji bzhin du med pa de rnam par 'jog pa na bag bzungs dang ltag chod kyi sbyor bar byed de; bgab zungs dang ltag chod kyi sbyor ba ni /
translated: the bodhisattva who views the absence of characteristics does not accept any position.🔽When establishing that things do not exist as they are described, he engages in sophistry and quibbling.

original: g-yo smra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: g-yo smra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Engaging in sophistry and quibbling is called deceptive speech.

original: de'i phyir g-yo'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yo'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of deception.

original: de la chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: As for the view of punishment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang khas mi len par lta ba dang / g-yo'i lta ba smra ba de nyid smra ba snying po med pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyi dus thams cad du chad pas bcad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang khas mi len par lta ba dang / g-yo'i lta ba smra ba de nyid smra ba snying po med pa'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyi dus thams cad du chad pas bcad par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who does not accept, who speaks of a view of deception, is cut off by the wise at all times because his speech is insubstantial.

original: de'i phyir chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of being cut off.

original: de la bkur sti byed par lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la bkur sti byed par lta ba ni /
translated: The view of making offerings is as follows.🔽The bodhisattva who views the signless as nonexistent views these views as taught by the Tathāgata.

original: gang med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid ltar gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i lta ba de lta bu 'di dag la brten pa de ni /🔽ston pa la bsti stang byed /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan mar lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid ltar gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i lta ba de lta bu 'di dag la brten pa de ni / ston pa la bsti stang byed /
translated: He views those who rely on them as🔽making offerings to the Teacher,

original: bla mar byed /🔽ri mor byed pa yin par lta ba de ni /
analyzed: bla mar byed / ri mor byed pa yin par lta ba de ni /
translated: honoring him,🔽and respecting him.

original: rim gro byed pa @32b ma yin te /
analyzed: rim gro byed pa @32b ma yin te /
translated: He does not view them as making offerings.

original: de'i phyir bkur sti byed par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bkur sti byed par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of making offerings.

original: de la skur pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la skur pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view of denigration is as follows.

original: gang bkur sti byed par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la skur par byed de; bsti stang mi byed pa 'ba' zhig ni /🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: gang bkur sti byed par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la skur par byed de; bsti stang mi byed pa 'ba' zhig ni / ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who views the one who is honored as the Tathagata is one who deprecates the Tathagata, not one who does not honor him.

original: de'i phyir skur pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skur pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of deprecation.

original: de la rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba ni /🔽gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de sgra ji bzhin du mngon par ma zhen pa phyin ci ma log par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis rigs par bstan cing rnam pa du mar bzlog pa byas kyang lta ba de
analyzed: de la rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba ni / gang med pa'i mtshan ma la lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de sgra ji bzhin du mngon par ma zhen pa phyin ci ma log par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis rigs par bstan cing rnam pa du mar bzlog pa byas kyang lta ba de
translated: The view of firm delusion is that of the bodhisattva who views a sign of non-existence.

original: las bskyod par mi nus te /
analyzed: las bskyod par mi nus te /
translated: Even though the bodhisattva who does not adhere literally to the letter of the teaching, and who is not mistaken, is taught with reasoning and is dissuaded in many ways by other bodhisattvas, he is unable to be moved from that view.

original: de'i phyir rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //🔽de la mi smra ba'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o // de la mi smra ba'i lta ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of firm delusion.🔽The view of silence is that of the bodhisattva who has the view of firm defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' de nyid mi smra ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' de nyid mi smra ba'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That very bodhisattva is called one who has the view of silence.

original: de la lta ba chen po ni /
analyzed: de la lta ba chen po ni /
translated: The view of the great is that of the bodhisattva who has the view of the great.

original: lta ba nyi shu rtsa drug po de dag thams cad la lta ba chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba nyi shu rtsa drug po de dag thams cad la lta ba chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these twenty-six views are called “great views.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lta ba 'di ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ni /
analyzed: lta ba 'di ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ni /
translated: These views are not as great as the sixty-two views that arise from the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: ji lta ji ltar kha na ma tho ba che ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar kha na ma tho ba che ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not as great as the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de'i phyir lta ba chen po zhes bya'o //🔽ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes shing don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes nas de ltar lta ba med par lta ba yongs su brjod pas dus tshad med par las @33a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba chen po zhes bya'o // ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes shing don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes nas de ltar lta ba med par lta ba yongs su brjod pas dus tshad med par las @33a *//
translated: Therefore, they are called “great views.”🔽Just as the bodhisattva, who perceives what is not the Dharma as the Dharma and what is not the meaning as the meaning, accumulates the karma of the obscuration of views for an immeasurable time by describing nonviews as views,

original: kyi sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin pa chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'jig rten kun tu sbyor ba ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: kyi sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin pa chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'jig rten kun tu sbyor ba ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: in the same way, the views that arise from the root of the view of the transitory collection are not as great as the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de ltar chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyi 'jig rten kun tu sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las kyi 'jig rten kun tu sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the world is not completely bound by the karma that leads to the loss of the Dharma.

original: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba ni /
translated: Among these, the view of overestimation is as follows:

original: lta ba chen po nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba chen po nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The view of overestimation is called the “great view.”

original: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par rlom sems su byed pas log par lta ba 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par rlom sems su byed pas log par lta ba 'di 'byung ste /
translated: This wrong view arises from overestimation of the literal meaning of the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the view of overestimation.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la sgra ji bzhin du ma yin par dgongs pa las byung ba'i don la tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa la ni; 'phags pa'i lta ba rnams med par yang lta ba 'di dag mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la sgra ji bzhin du ma yin par dgongs pa las byung ba'i don la tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa la ni; 'phags pa'i lta ba rnams med par yang lta ba 'di dag mi 'byung ste /
translated: In this regard, the view of overestimation does not arise in the bodhisattva who correctly reflects on the meaning that arises from the intention of the Great Vehicle, not on the literal meaning.

original: theg pa chen po la dad cing yid la mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la dad cing yid la mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: He has faith in the Great Vehicle and is inclined toward it.

original: de'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa skye ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa skye ba ni /
translated: The arising of faith in the Great Vehicle that follows the proper mental attentions to the Great Vehicle is

original: don chen po yin no //
analyzed: don chen po yin no //
translated: a great benefit.

original: chos la'ang chos su 'du shes shing don la'ang don du 'du shes pa yin te; 'di ni /
analyzed: chos la'ang chos su 'du shes shing don la'ang don du 'du shes pa yin te; 'di ni /
translated: One perceives the Dharma as the Dharma and the meaning as the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yid la byed pa las skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yid la byed pa las skye'o //
translated: This is the arising of faith in the Great Vehicle that is due to mental attention to the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma /
translated: Chapter Two

original: byang chub @33b sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub @33b sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Mahāmati asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽what is the arising of faith in the Great Vehicle that is due to the practice of the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa spyod pa las skye ba gang lags; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa spyod pa las skye ba gang lags; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas ji lta ji lta bur theg pa chen po'i chos bris nas 'chang ba dang / dran par byed pa dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan la bgod par byed pa dang / klog pa dang / nyan pa dang / 'don pa dang /🔽kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher rab tu ston pa dang / tshul bzhin sems pa dang / de ji lta ji lta bur sgom pa'i rnam pa'i bar du sbyor zhing de lta de ltar sbyor ba de tsam du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas ji lta ji lta bur theg pa chen po'i chos bris nas 'chang ba dang / dran par byed pa dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan la bgod par byed pa dang / klog pa dang / nyan pa dang / 'don pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher rab tu ston pa dang / tshul bzhin sems pa dang / de ji lta ji lta bur sgom pa'i rnam pa'i bar du sbyor zhing de lta de ltar sbyor ba de tsam du 'di lta ste /
translated: “The bodhisattvas, in whatever way they write down the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, keep it, make it known, worship it, distribute it to others, read it, listen to it, recite it,

original: sngon ma thos pa dang / sngon thos pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir gus pa'i dad pa sgom po nas skye ste /
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa dang / sngon thos pa brtan par bya ba'i phyir gus pa'i dad pa sgom po nas skye ste /
translated: recite it aloud, teach it extensively to others, reflect on it properly, and apply themselves to meditation on it, to that same extent they will develop devoted interest in the Great Vehicle, in order to stabilize what they have not previously heard and what they have previously heard.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa spyod pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa spyod pa las skye ba'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ devoted interest in the Great Vehicle that arises from practicing the Great Vehicle.”

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'dris pa las skye ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'dris pa las skye ba gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how does the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is related to the Great Vehicle arise from familiarity?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'di ltar mang du byed pa ni /🔽theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa chung ngu la @34a *//
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'di ltar mang du byed pa ni / theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa chung ngu la @34a *//
translated: the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is related to the Great Vehicle arises from familiarity in the following way.

original: brten nas 'bring thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: brten nas 'bring thob par 'gyur /
translated: Based on the lesser trust in the Great Vehicle that is related to the Great Vehicle, they attain the middling.

original: theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'bring la brten nas theg pa chen po thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'bring la brten nas theg pa chen po thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Based on the middling trust in the Great Vehicle that is related to the Great Vehicle, they attain the greater.

original: dad pa des dad pa'i shas chen po thob nas dad pa mang du gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dad pa des dad pa'i shas chen po thob nas dad pa mang du gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: Having attained the greater trust through that trust, they remain in the Great Vehicle.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'dris pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa 'dris pa las skye ba'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is related to the Great Vehicle arises from familiarity.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked,🔽“Blessed One, how does the bodhisattvas’ trust in the Great Vehicle that is related to the Great Vehicle arise from accomplishment?”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yongs su mi skyo ba las skye ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yongs su mi skyo ba las skye ba gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva’s great vehicle, and what is the faith in the Great Vehicle that arises from not being discouraged?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' de ltar dad pa shas chen po rnyed nas yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' de ltar dad pa shas chen po rnyed nas yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: when bodhisattvas have thus acquired great faith, they are not discouraged.

original: rgyun mi chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du yongs su mi skyo //
analyzed: rgyun mi chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du yongs su mi skyo //
translated: They are not discouraged in their uninterrupted application to virtue.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi skyo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi skyo //
translated: They are not discouraged by the sufferings of saṃsāra.

original: sems can log par zhugs pa thams cad kyis yongs su mi skyo //
analyzed: sems can log par zhugs pa thams cad kyis yongs su mi skyo //
translated: They are not discouraged by all the wrongdoings of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' bspyod pas yongs su mi skyo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' bspyod pas yongs su mi skyo //
translated: They are not discouraged by the hardships of the bodhisattva.

original: de de ltar yongs su mi skyo bas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams mnyes par byed de theg pa chen po la dad pa'i rkyen kyang rnyed do //
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su mi skyo bas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams mnyes par byed de theg pa chen po la dad pa'i rkyen kyang rnyed do //
translated: In this way, through being undaunted, they please the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and spiritual friends and thus acquire the conditions for faith in the Great Vehicle.”

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa skyed cing sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod de sbyor ba ma @34b btang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa skyed cing sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod de sbyor ba ma @34b btang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one generates faith in the Great Vehicle and one's practice is uninterrupted, for one does not abandon practice.

original: des na de rgyun mi chad par theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa de 'jug ste /
analyzed: des na de rgyun mi chad par theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa de 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, one's faith in the Great Vehicle for the sake of the Great Vehicle is uninterrupted.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yongs su mi skyo ba las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yongs su mi skyo ba las skye ba'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas' faith in the Great Vehicle for the sake of the Great Vehicle, which arises from indefatigability.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The bodhisattva great being Dharmodgata said, Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yongs su bskang ba las skye ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa yongs su bskang ba las skye ba gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas' faith in the Great Vehicle for the sake of the Great Vehicle, which arises from fulfillment?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: ston pa'i che ba nyid la mos pa shin tu ma rung bar ma byas par rig nas ston pa la mos pa 'jug pa theg pa chen po'i chos gsang ba dag la mos pa 'jug go /
translated: Knowing that it is not right to have no conviction in the greatness of the teacher, one enters into conviction in the teacher.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ji ltar khong du chud cing rtogs nas theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing gsang ba de dag la dad pa thob pa de ltar khong du ma chud cing ma rtogs kyang byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i stobs bskyed pas chos de
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ji ltar khong du chud cing rtogs nas theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing gsang ba de dag la dad pa thob pa de ltar khong du ma chud cing ma rtogs kyang byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i stobs bskyed pas chos de
translated: The more bodhisattvas understand and realize and thus attain faith in those profound and secret teachings of the Great Vehicle, the more they will attain faith in those teachings even though they have not understood and realized them.

original: dag la dad pa thob ste /
analyzed: dag la dad pa thob ste /
translated: This is the power of conviction.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa ston pa tshad mar byas pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i phyir theg pa chen po la dad pa ston pa tshad mar byas pa las skye ba'o //
translated: This is the arising of the bodhisattvas’ faith in the Great Vehicle that leads to the Great Vehicle, based on the authority of the teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dad pa thabs chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: Bodhisattva Mahāmati said:

original: de ltar skye ba sna tshogs 'di dag gis theg pa chen po la dad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas theg pa chen po'i chos gang yid la bgyis te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba sna tshogs 'di dag gis theg pa chen po la dad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas theg pa chen po'i chos gang yid la bgyis te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: “The bodhisattvas who have attained faith in the Great Vehicle through these various births, what Great Vehicle teachings should they keep in mind in order to accomplish unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: theg pa chen po la dad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas dpag tu med pa bcu yid la byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la dad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas dpag tu med pa bcu yid la byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas who have attained faith in the Great Vehicle should accomplish unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by keeping in mind the ten immeasurables.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: chos dpag tu med pa dang / zab ba dpag tu med pa dang / brjod pa dpag tu med pa dang / tshig rab @38a *//
analyzed: chos dpag tu med pa dang / zab ba dpag tu med pa dang / brjod pa dpag tu med pa dang / tshig rab @38a *//
translated: the profound is immeasurable, the expressions are immeasurable, the divisions of the words are immeasurable,

original: tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa dang / sems can dpag tu med pa dang / rjes su gzung ba dpag tu med pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dpag tu med pa dang / dkon mchog gi che ba nyid dpag tu med pa dang /
analyzed: tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa dang / sems can dpag tu med pa dang / rjes su gzung ba dpag tu med pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dpag tu med pa dang / dkon mchog gi che ba nyid dpag tu med pa dang /
translated: the sentient beings are immeasurable, the guidance is immeasurable, the skillful means are immeasurable, the greatness of the Jewels is immeasurable,

original: zhing dpag tu med pa dang / las dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: zhing dpag tu med pa dang / las dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: the fields are immeasurable, and the actions are immeasurable.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: de la chos dpag tu med pa ni /
analyzed: de la chos dpag tu med pa ni /
translated: Regarding this, the immeasurable Dharma

original: gang mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi sde snod du gtogs pa dang / de'i yan lag tu gtogs pa rnams kyi chos dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: gang mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi sde snod du gtogs pa dang / de'i yan lag tu gtogs pa rnams kyi chos dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: is the immeasurable Dharma of the scriptures and their branches, which are the teachings of the sūtras, the melodious teachings, the prophecies, and so forth.

original: de la zab pa dpag tu med pa ni /
analyzed: de la zab pa dpag tu med pa ni /
translated: Regarding this, the immeasurable profundity

original: gang theg pa chen po la gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs rnams kyis bstan pa tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: gang theg pa chen po la gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs rnams kyis bstan pa tshad med pa dang /
translated: The Great Vehicle is taught with limitless enumerations of the selflessness of persons, the selflessness of phenomena, emptiness, suchness, the perfect limit, the absence of marks, the ultimate, and the expanse of reality.

original: dgongs pa las byung ba dang / zab pa bstan pa dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa las byung ba dang / zab pa bstan pa dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is taught with limitless profound expressions that arise from the intention.

original: de la brjod pa dpag tu med pa ni /
analyzed: de la brjod pa dpag tu med pa ni /
translated: “The limitless expressions are as follows:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: brjod pa gang dang gang gis sems can dang / chos dang / don rtogs par 'gyur ba tha na dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su song ba'i sems can rnams la'ang ji tsam du tshig brjod pa de dang des don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung brjod pa rnams dpag tu med par 'byung @38b
analyzed: brjod pa gang dang gang gis sems can dang / chos dang / don rtogs par 'gyur ba tha na dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su song ba'i sems can rnams la'ang ji tsam du tshig brjod pa de dang des don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung brjod pa rnams dpag tu med par 'byung @38b
translated: the tathāgatas’ limitless expressions arise in order to make beings, phenomena, and meanings comprehensible through whatever expressions are used, even for beings who have taken birth as animals.

original: ba'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: ba'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de tshig rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa ni /
analyzed: de tshig rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa ni /
translated: The divisions of the words are immeasurable.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: sems can rnams la 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas tshig rab tu dbye ba'i sgo mang po nye bar ston cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas tshig rab tu dbye ba'i sgo mang po nye bar ston cing /
translated: For the sake of disciplining sentient beings, the Tathāgata teaches many doors of the divisions of words.

analyzed: don re re la'ang tshig rab tu dbye ba tshad med pa dag gis rnam grangs su phye ste rab tu ston pa'o //

analyzed: de la sems can dpag tu med pa ni /

original: gang skye ba'i 'khor ba thog ma dang / tha ma med pa dang / kun tu rgyug pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon pas sems can dpag tu med do //
analyzed: gang skye ba'i 'khor ba thog ma dang / tha ma med pa dang / kun tu rgyug pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon pas sems can dpag tu med do //
translated: Those who are born in saṃsāra without beginning or end, who run around, whose suffering in saṃsāra is without a prior limit, are immeasurable sentient beings.🔽Among them, the immeasurable guidance is as follows:

original: de la rjes su gzung ba dpag tu med pa ni; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de la rjes su gzung ba dpag tu med pa ni; rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di lta ste /
